Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: uplcmnm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Little Italy, San Diego -- one of my most favorite spots to visit. La Pensione is located in the heart of Little Italy. It is walking distance or a train or bus ride to all the hot spots you will want to visit. The hotel rooms are small; yet, quaint and cozy. The only negative would be that there was no a/c when I stayed. However, there is a ceiling fan and if the temp is not too high out, a/c is not needed anyway. Also, parking can be a pain, so try to get a spot in the garage and plan to keep your car parked. Public transportation is excellent in this area.

Reviews.Title: “handy small hotel”
Reviews.Author: corkboy2009
Reviews.Content: The lady at reception was a bit grumpy, but this doesn't matter since this hotel is so well located. Underground car park is handy but not cheap. The rooms are small but functional. Plenty places nearby to eat. The coffee place next door has free wifi so you can piggyback on it. Some hairs found in the shower from the previous guest, but other than that clean. Great place to locate for a week-end away (if you are patying out of your own pocket!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DayTripper084
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Pensione Hotel because of the great value. This was part of the package that had been offered, but I was pleasantly surprised by this little gem, particularly with the location. It is a small place, but if you do not intend to spend all your time in the room, which I don't, it works. It's in the heart of Little Italy and is surrounded by some nice restaurants. The other plus was that public transportation was very accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: KatCanuck
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 5 nights in March while doing the tourist thing in San Diego. It's a well-priced alternative to the usual expensive San Diego hotels, and extremely well located in the heart of Little Italy - walking distance to almost everything except Old Town. About 15-20min to Horton Plaza and Gastown, good 20-30 min (uphill) to Balboa Park, easy 10min to the waterfront, and then along towards the Midway Museum, ferry to Coronado, etc. Little Italy itself has lots of restaurants, and a cute Saturday morning mercado (market) right ouside the doors of the hotel. There is definitely a "high-end dorm" feeling to this hotel compared to more expensive hotels, but far and above staying at a hostel etc. A warning - the rooms really are TINY, but that is the trade-off for the price. Also I think some of the rooms might be better in terms of size and view than others - I unfortunately got a room with a window facing a very near wall of the next building, but I couldn't be bothered to ask for a change since I was out-and-about exploring the city all day and really only in the room at night. Rooms are simple, but nicely updated and modern, the beds very comfortable, fridge in room, and for the price compared to other San Diego hotels, this is really a good deal if you're on a budget and don't require luxury but don't want to go too cheap either. The rooms were clean, but I did notice that some non-main areas had a good layer of dust (TV, top of head-board, top of clothing shelf, etc) and my bathtub wasn't really cleaned well each day, oh well. It was also quite late in the day before rooms got cleaned, sometimes I'd be out from 9am-2pm and the room still had to be done. No alarm clock and no coffee makers in the rooms. The coffee shop downstairs though was really good (Cafe Italia). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego wanting to be walking distance to everything without breaking the bank, and would easily stay here myself again also.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, stay here for conferences”
Reviews.Author: WCO6Girl
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are in town for a conference forget the $200 hotel and stay here. It's $110 with free wireless internet! What is not to love about that. It is a great part of town with plenty of restaurants and a great vibe. The rooms are small yes--rather European like. But if you are in town for a conference you are only using the room to sleep and shower in anyway. The rooms are small, no clock, and no conditioner provided. On the up side--free wifi, a frig in the room, great counter space at the sink, and a place to hang up your clothes. This hotel is a gem. If you like to exercise there's a small exercise room and running along the bay is great. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: markjackson100
Reviews.Content: A terrific hotel in a great location. The old adage goes that you get what you pay for - and in accommodation this is very true. But La Pensione delivers more than you expect for the tarrif they charge. A previous reviewer made some mention of a dorm type feel to the place and that is the case. But it's almost like staying with a remote relative. The rooms are clean and well maintained without being luxurious, and the public spaces are pretty limited. I disliked the fact that no tea or coffee was available in the room, but they have a cofee shop downstairs which would have been better than instant anyway. But overall, it would be hard to get better value in the area, maybe even in San Diego. And right across the road is Mimmos - the best Italian food this side of Sicily!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Little Italy, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Chazdeboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last September at the start of our Californian trip. It's in a fantastic spot in Little Italy. The room was clean and had an ensuite bathroom, wardrobe, dressing table, TV and fridge. The staff on the reception were very helpful indeed, especially when it came to advising us where to go and how to get around the city. There's a 7-11 shop nearby, plus plenty of lovely Italian restuarants to eat breakfast, lunch and tea. The "trolley" stop (trams to people from the UK) was a short walk away which was great. Trollies are a great way to get around the city (which is beautiful and clean)

Reviews.Title: “La Pensione great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Steve L
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Little Italy. Great location with great staff and clean rooms. Many excellent restaurants close by. Location allows quick access to harbor, Gas Lamp district and other downtown places of interest. Safe neighborhood also.

Reviews.Title: “Was that Rod Serling in the elevator?”
Reviews.Author: 5scheidemona
Reviews.Content: We chose La Pensione for its location in the heart of Little Italy, SD and we could not have done better. It was in the very midst of the 'mercato' and 'Carnevale' activities of 18 February - perfect! We step out the doors and we have the whole neighbourhood's activities right at arm's length ... to say nothing of the amazing vantage point of the (tiny) balcony on the third floor that allowed us to take some of the best photos of our trip. If location is what you are looking for, this is certainly one of the best places. It is also a rather smart, 'boutique' hotel with cool furniture in the lounging areas and a charming faux fire place in the lobby. Having said that, please be aware that the regular rooms are rather small though still very clean and pleasant. The parking area is more suited for FIAT 500s or Vespas than your average car but the elevator may remind you of a Twilight Zone episode. If Rod Serling had greeted me as I got on to fetch the car just before our checkout, I wouldn't have blinked ... except, of course for the fact that he's been dead a long time ... . Then again, as they say, "a Carnevale, ogni scherzo vale." If you are prepared to be patient with the elevator, you are bound to enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: david_andrews
Reviews.Content: When I was in grad school, I attended 2 conferences in San Diego. As a poor student I didn't have much money to spend. Thank God for La Pensione! This is a really lovely but no frills hotel, a step up from a hostel but it does have a sort of college-dorm feel (right down to the laundry room off the reception), and a bit of chic-ness. It's about a mile walk from the convention center, but in a beautiful neighborhood (Little Italy) with many great restaurants and coffee shops at your doorstep. There is a tram stop a block or two away. Stay here if you are on a budget. NB: my last trip here was in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely visit worth repeating.”
Reviews.Author: mrsdagle
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my weekend stay here. Inexpensive, nice, friendly staff and great location. We often had our window open to enjoy the air and it wasn't noisy. We would definitely stay here again. I think a microwave would have been nice to go along with the fridge. Otherwise a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Chic”
Reviews.Author: kbwoods
Reviews.Content: Let's just get the biggest negative of the weekend out of the way first because it was such a small blip in an otherwise perfect experience. The biggest negative I experienced all weekend was that I could not get wireless. I was told to hook into the Cafe's wireless but the signal was too weak. The front desk gave me the password, which I think they assumed I already had, but it didn't work, even after a second call down to confirm that I had it right. But, you know, they would have solved it if I had pursued it (I had my iPhone so I didn't) because they were just nice like that. Okay. Phew. Glad that's over. Now let's move on to the really good things about this hotel. This was the perfect choice for a quick weekend getaway to catch the Pacific Standard Time shows at the MCASDs. I reserved an "Argento Single". Too small. No place to even hang clothes. I ran back down to the front desk, asking for a bigger room. For a slight price increase, Room 320 is a larger (I didn't say LARGE) corner room with a balcony overlooking the hub of Little Italy. A place to hang clothes, a desk, mini-fridge and windows on two sides. Perfect...for one person (or two who really like each other). I did see, through an open door, a much bigger room so they do exist. But Room 320 was perfect for me. The room was very clean, chic decor (recently redone), comfy bed. It's not a luxury hotel. The amenities were few; shampoo (no conditioner), soap (no lotion), a hairdryer. I didn't see a clock in my room but who wants a clock when you are on vacation? Beyond the room, the hotel is charming. Great front desk staff, helpful housekeeping, a mascot terrier, low-key attitude and peaceful. The four or five-block Little Italy Farmer's Market on Saturday is right outside the hotel and the great band that was set up on the corner opposite my room made a nice Saturday even more enjoyable. Somehow attached to the hotel is Cafe Italia which is where my mornings began (also great sandwiches for lunch). The street is loaded with restaurants and bars (this is where central location of your hotel might come in handy), a couple of nearby convenience stores plus walking distance to many other points of interest. All that right outside the door of this wonderful little hotel. If I were to do it all over, I would again chose to stay at La Pensione.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: luvtoCancun
Reviews.Content: When we are lucky enough for a weekend getaway, this is the place we go! We LOVE the location, the rooms are always clean, the staff is always helpful. The rooms are small but no big deal, parking is always a hassle but no biggie. It sure is a treat to visit La Pensione, what makes it even more special is the Farmers Market. I love the coffee nearby and all the restaurants as well. We dont stay anywhere else in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: TheParrothead
Reviews.Content: Le Pension is a great value in a perfect location. Smack in the middle of Little Italy, it's walking distance to everything. Rooms are very European (small and sparse, but liveable). Beds were a smidge hard, but that too is a European standard. Lobby is pretty cool with a chic fire. Loved the water feature in the courtyard. By the time we checked in at 7 pm, underground parking was full. Street parking is hard to come by, so we had to find a pay lot...another $5 until 6 am....$10 more if you stay later. Our room opened to the courtyard where there was a large dinner party. Kinda loud, but we were just changing clothes to go back out, so it was ok. By the time we got back (around midnight), it was quiet. Overall, it was a nice stay in Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “3 rooms in one night!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya V
Reviews.Content: So my husband and I stayed here about 3 years ago without any issues and thought we would have the same experience this time around. Boy, were we wrong! First, they assigned a room that had a "do not disturb" sign on the door and the room hadn't been cleaned. We then had to go back to the lobby to request a clean room. This room wasn't much better. The AC unit even when turned off made a buzzing alarm sound every 5-15 minutes. At 11 p.m. we called down to inform them of this and were told "yeah, a lot of them do that". We then asked for another room and had to pack up all of our things, go down to the lobby and get another room. Thankfully, the AC unit was quiet in this one. Apart from that, you can't possibly open your windows due to the airplane and train noises outside. On the positive side, the location is great and they have a nice little courtyard directly behind the coffee shop, but this is not enough for us to return. I would recommend paying a bit more for a more well kept hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: wnuval
Reviews.Content: What's not to love about this hotel? First, LOCATION. Right smack dab in Little Italy. Just a few steps to the best pizza, pasta and gelato ever. Step out of the front door on a Saturday morning, and you're in the middle of the Farmer's Market. And walking distance to fabulous Balboa Park to the east, and the San Diego bay to the west. Second, CHARMING as all get out. This hotel is perfect for couples - the rooms are super small and intimate, all the amenities you need, plus an empty mini-fridge to store the fresh juice and food you buy at the Farmer's Market! A coffee shop downstairs with a little courtyard also. Reminded me of our hostel in Spain. Courteous and helpful front desk. And it didn't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our time in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: Harris_Jayhawker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at La Pensione in August 2011 for a few days before heading north along the coast. It was great for our purposes. While the rooms are a bit small we found them comfortable and functional. The hotel is clean, perfectly situated and friendly. Our only annoyance was that parking could be an issue, especially if you're staying on a weekend. Once we had to park several blocks from the hotel which was fine for us but it could be an issue for a couple with mobility problems. Overall great hotel and we will consider them the next time we're in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: gonicki
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love La Pensione! I have stayed here a million times for everything from a romantic weekend with the bf to attending an event at the convention center with friends. The price is hard to beat in the downtown area. Couldn't ask for a better location--located right in the heart of Little Italy with tons of restaurants nearby and a coffee shop located on the first floor. Close to Gaslamp/downtown, the convention center, and the Kettner train station (roughly a $5-$7 cab ride to any of those). The rooms are very small--but very clean and updated. Pretty sure they all have mini fridges too. Parking is tight, but they do have an underground garage. The only thing I don't care for is the front desk staff. In all my years of staying there, I've never met anyone working the front desk who was particularly personable. Kind of a strange phenomenon--but since I'm not trying to be besties with anyone who works there, I just ignore their general surliness. Plus, Penny the dog who lives on site makes up for any non-friendly behavior anyone else at the front desk might exhibit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hapsci
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location. Rooms are clean, hotel receptionist was nice and friendly. Located right in little italy, perfect for the bars and restaurants. Close to the San diego old town trolley tour bus stop too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Eurpoean”
Reviews.Author: misterfisher2006
Reviews.Content: Well, I read the reviews and booked this hotel anyway for an overnight, and I'm glad I did. It is European in so many ways -- small room, very slow elevator, very nice people -- but I'm OK with that. At 6'3" I don't fit into really small spaces, but the room was just not that small; certainly bigger than the single I got booked into in Paris one time. Everything in the room worked, nothing was broken, and it is walking distance from the Amtrak station, very close to the trolley stop, and right smack dab in the middle of San Diego's Little Italy. My only negative comment, no clock radio in the room, but those seem to be disappearing from hotels across the nation, so... .

Reviews.Title: “False advertising and lousy customer service”
Reviews.Author: marganm
Reviews.Content: I just left La Pensione and am compelled to share my utter disbelief and disappointment with how they handled what could have been a very simple problem. I was in San Diego to attend a conference and needed an Internet connection for work. Some how, I ended up in a hotel without in-room connection, so after the first night I hunted around for a room. There were not a lot of choices under $200 night (my budget), but I found La Pensione. Just to be sure of the hotel and its service, I went to the hotel before making the reservation. I spoke with a woman at the front desk and confirmed the in-room Internet service, which is also advertised on their site. Given the great location and relatively okay look and feel of the modest hotel, I made a reservation. When I showed up to move in, I again confirmed the Internet connection. That first night, after my conference, I tried to log on. No luck. The person at the front desk "rebooted the system", but still no connection. I had to send out several lengthy emails thru my cell phone. The next night, the same thing. I was very disappointed and would have understood were they to tell me that the system was down, but they could not have been less interested in the issue. That night, I approached the manager, Javier,at the front desk. He said that the Internet didn't work as well in some rooms of the hotel. I told him that I had expressed my need for the Internet very clearly on more than one occasion. He then said something about it being Comcast's problem. I requested a price reduction, given that I had paid their walk-in rate of $129 for a very (underscore very) modest room and expected Internet to be included in that charge. A very modest $10/day would have shown me that he cared about the inconvenience, but he said he'd have to check with someone who was traveling. This morning, I woke up and went to check out. The woman who had originally told me that the rooms had Internet was at the front desk. I told her about the conversation with the manager last night and asked if they final bill reflected a rebate. It did not, and she had not heard anything about it. She would have to try to get a hold of the manager, Javier. I left my suitcase there and went off to my conference. I returned at noon to retrieve my suitcase and settle the bill. The woman said that Javier denied any kind of reduction. When I asked her if she thought this seemed wrong, given that she, herself, had "sold" me on the Internet service, she replied, "I dunno". Anyway, it's left me VERY upset. I could have dealt with the service interruption if they had been decent about the issue, acknowledged it and sought to make me feel better. Customer service at this level needs to be pointed out. This staff needs some simple training.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place. Good price...pretty good location.”
Reviews.Author: funlovingcouple157
Reviews.Content: We did like the location of the hotel very much in relation to the USS Midway, Seaport Village, and Little Italy. Here are the few things that we did not like about the place. The airconditioning in the room that we were in was terrible. My wife and I were extremely hot and had trouble sleeping each night. We had to open up a window to get a little air movement through our room. This only made the noise from the airport and trains worse than it already was...it was a no win for us. What we did like about this property. Little Italy has some great bars, restaurants, and breakfast spots to frequent at almost any time of the night. It took about 30 minutes of brisk walking to get to Gaslamp....a little over a mile of walking. There is a fair amount of traffic lights which will slow you down some. It is really easier to get a bus pass or take a taxi...an added expense but possibly worth not having to walk back later at night. Overall a decent place but did not wow us like a lot of the other users on this review list.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service - Avoid This Place!”
Reviews.Author: NeilSchierholz
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here in 2008 and enjoyed the experience very much. Since then this hotel has, unfortunately, gone horribly downhill, primarily in customer service. We had so many problems with our stay from the moment we made the reservation until we departed. Had we not stayed there before and enjoyed it we would have "seen the writing on the wall" and cancelled our stay much earlier. The staff are completely unenthusiastic and uncaring. The manager, Javier, seems to have no training in customer service. Problems we experienced were met only with defensive denial or rationalizations. DON'T STAY HERE, regardless of what you read to the contrary. Read the most-recent reviews and you will realize that this hotel has gone horribly downhill and does not deserve your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: SarahFaugh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference on the Bayfront which was a thirty minute walk away. My room was small but clean and everything worked. I noticed the train but it didn't bother me too much. The staff were there and helpful when I needed them, which wasn't much. I enjoyed the atmosphere around the hotel especially on Saturday morning with the Farmer's Market. Very good value much cheaper than all the other hotels the conference guests were staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: jo1960
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Little Italy and surrounded by fantastic restaurants and bars and a 15 to 20 minute walk to the Gaslamp area of San Diego - absolutely perfect location. The staff are warm and welcoming and efficient. The whole place is very clean including the bedroom. We were there for 8 nights and although the room had everything you needed it was a little compact and the bed being a little smaller than we are used to and not the best quality mattress we had slept on during our trip - not bad enough not to go back though. Perfect for a one or two night stop. However, value for money cannot be denied and for a long stay in the city the price is hard to beat. One downside was the inability to access wi-fi in your bedroom, you either had to sit out in the hallway by the elevators or go down to the lobby - a slight inconvenience. We are planning on going back to San Diego Dec.11 for our 4th visit and we will certainly be seriously considering a return visit to La Pensione.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: RoaryCat
Reviews.Content: In a great location in San Diego's Little Italy, La Pensione is a quaint hotel that provides great value in San Diego. We spent 2 nights there in early February, spending under $100 a night, which is a great value in San Diego. Check-in was great, we arrived around noon and we were given a room immediately. The room was small but clean and comfortable. There is a nice courtyard much like some of the places I stayed in Europe (very European flavor to the hotel) which connected to a coffee shop and an Italian restaurant. There are many restaurants immediately around the hotel and the trolley/light rail line to Old Town and Tijuana is located just 2-3 blocks from the hotel. If you want to walk to downtown or the Gaslamp District is only takes about 15 minutes. There is a bar kitty corner that does play loud music at night but when I closed the windows the noise was significantly lower. All in all, a great value and great place to stay in a magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Time Well Spent”
Reviews.Author: WyoBarb
Reviews.Content: We found La Pensione about 15 years ago and have been coming back ever since. There have been many improvements made to this hotel to make it as comfortable as possible. The room/bathroom is kept impeccably clean. The beds are comfortable with good linens and great pillows. We fly in and take a taxi to the hotel; the taxi fare from the airport to the hotel is $10-11. Javier, the manager, and staff have been super courteous to us. We never have a problem with check-in and check-out. We stayed here for 5 days during the Saturday morning Farmer's Market and the Sunday Italian Festa. I am continually amazed at how clean the community workers keep the Little Italy area. The location perfect and safe for walking. Many coffee shops and restaurants on the same street offer delicious food in a wide range of prices. A vehicle has never been necessary with the public transportation that is available. The trolley line is a few blocks from the hotel; very safe to walk to. Buy a 4-day pass for $15 (senior rate). Your pass will take you to all the places of interest in the San Diego area on either the trolley or bus. We wouldn't think about staying anywhere else when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: sdman17
Reviews.Content: After being kept awake for about a half hour late at night by the occupants of a neighboring room, I called the front desk to ask if we could be moved to another room or if they could ask the loud guest to quiet down. They did neither and never called up back to see if we were satisfied with their resolution. The next morning I called to speak with the manager since he was not onsite to voice my displeasure at how the situation was handled and he actually shouted at me on the phone and accused me of making the phone call to try and get another stay for free! I had actually called to inform him how ineffective his employees were at resolving the issue the previous night and that I would not be staying there ever again. Basically terrible customer service and managers who don't stand behind their services.

Reviews.Title: “Like being in Europe”
Reviews.Author: jaslady
Reviews.Content: La Pensione is a small European type hotel with small rooms and no chain type extras. Just the basics but it's very comfy and clean, a fitness center will be completed by 2011. We parked in a garage under the hotel which was handy (there is a cost added to the room for this). Hotel is very reasonable considering its location. We awakened to church bells (real, not recorded) and then walked to mass each morning two blocks away to the beautiful church which looks unassuming until you enter! Then you see beautiful cathedral type stained glass windows and other lovely art. It's inspiring and amazing. Then there are the restaurants! The pastry chefs outdo themselves to create the most delicious temptations and of course each Italian restaurant is better than the last. Restaurant employees are well trained and quite charming (naturally, they're Italian!) Coffee shops abound and it's fun to take a brisk morning walk a few blocks to the harbor and then settle in for coffee, pastry and the newspaper while watching folks rushing off to work or school. The hotel is minutes from the airport and car rentals, as well as all the harbor activities and tours. There are also a number of art shops. Weeknights you'll hear the chatter of folks walking to and fro as they visit restaurants or sit outdoors for late night coffee under the lights strung along the streets of this charming neighborhood. The hotel itself is very quiet. On Saturday, portions of the street in front are closed off for the market event--fresh everything plus art etc. I'll never stay in a chain hotel again when we visit! Note that you will be exposed to air traffic but it was no more than a background noise to us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: 1carryon
Reviews.Content: We almost didn't stay at this hotel because of some of the reviews we read. We are so happy that we decided to try it out because of it's location and price. It was wonderful. The only time we heard the train, was in the afternoon when we opened our window to see what the train would sound like. We could definitely hear it, but it was very warm in San Diego when we were there, so we had the air conditioning on and never heard the train again, and we were on the train side of the hotel. True, the room was small, but had all the amenities we needed. The air conditioner was a little tricky to master. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was very clean, and we felt like we were in Italy because the hotel is located in Little Italy and the decor is very European. All we had to do to dine was walk around the corner and we had a delicious Italian dinner and also ate at the same restaurant for breakfast the next morning, although there is a nice Coffee House connected to the hotel. We had no problem parking in the underground park, but that could be because of the time of the year as the hotel was not booked. You can take the train to San Diego and easily walk to the hotel from there. You don't need a car as there is a trolley that takes you all around San Diego. We will definitely return to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed to be without Air Conditioning - No Consolation Made”
Reviews.Author: Zen411
Reviews.Content: I helped my friends from Switzerland book this hotel. I didnt know that much about it other than there is a great coffee shop on the first level and is in a great location to Little Italy. Plenty to do. I gave them 3 choices and they chose this hotel based on price and location. When I asked them when they arrived how was the first night, they said rooms were small and they could hear the train but was ok. They are not complainers and feel blessed to be in such a situation for a hotel. The air conditioner broke in their room the 2nd day of their 3 day stay. Management was notified on my prodding and didnt fix it. It remained non-working for the remainder of their stay. We were going back and forth to the beach and it was warm not to mention, the TRAIN. Now I know about the train because I live in Mission Hills and I HEAR THE TRAIN. So, to cool themselves they have to leave the window open and they hear.... THE TRAIN. So, muggy room and the TRAIN with the window open. It would have been nice if they could have gotten what they paid for - which AC was part of the price. Little did they know that in the United States....You pay = you get. Nonetheless, I told them to ask for a discount upon check out. I guess management did not agree so I will not recommend this hotel. I think that is not so nice of them. Next time my Swiss friends come I will recommend another hotel to them. There are many other hotels in the area and that have a service policy.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the location, but BRING EARPLUGS”
Reviews.Author: Kaiyasmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been in a better spot. We parked our car in the garage and never once drove it. We walked everywhere. I even made it from our hotel to dinner at the Glass Door in 3 inch heels. The room was small but quaint. We had an ocean view which made anything negative livable. The biggest negative is that it is located right above the train. The first night I literally only slept 4 hours-due to the noise. The next night I bought earplugs at the RiteAid on Kettner St and slept like a baby. My favorite part was that right below the hotel was a tasty cafe called Cafe Italia, extremely delicious latte's and pastries. FYI-cash only. But there is a Wells Fargo ATM right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Here come the upgrades!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasDumptruck
Reviews.Content: Ok, first of all - read through all of the reviews & generally got the feel of the deal. It's a great location, the staff is friendly, there is a sweet dog in the lobby, but this is a great budget hotel & wouldn't it be great if......the owners put some money into the place. So fast forward to now. I am at the hotel & one of the owners (family place) is there helping to work on the place. Actually helping the workers with tile, hanging new big flat screens, new lighting, drapes, beds, carpet....and....he's happy to show me around the place & is truly excitied about where this is all going. Long and short of it is that this could be one of the best hidden gems in San Diego once they are done. My room was clean, comfortable, cheap, etc... They sold me. They have my business. Hats off to you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Noisy Trains”
Reviews.Author: AngelaIndigo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights and enjoyed the location in Little Italy. The hotel itself is cute, with friendly staff and small but clean rooms. The proximity to the rail service is a curse and a blessing. It was very convenient to walk to the trains, however they run all night and are extremely loud. Don't even try to sleep with the window open, we heard trains as late as 2AM and as early as 6AM. Closing the window helps, but it's still pretty loud. Other than that we loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fanbram
Reviews.Content: This is a small European style hotel with very small very clean rooms. The staff is very helpful and friendly. It is located in Little Italy and there are incredible choices of fine restaurants. The best Italian Restaurant is attached to the hotel (Vincenzo). You can walk to the Harbour, walk to the Gaslamp District and to Balboa Park. If you prefer public transportation, it's just one block away. If you are on a budget I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: GRFamily
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a concierge, work out gacilities, continental breakfast, and a quiet hotel, keep on looking..... If you want to stay in charming hotel with Penny (the Wheatland Terrier who lives there), a charming lobby with a fireplace, small efficiency rooms, this is for you! There is parking underneath and the Farmers Market (Sat) is terrifiic; make sure you catch a crepe and get some pesto to take home! Friday nights can be a bit noisy, but nothing you can't live through. If the room is hot when you check in, which is likely is, turn on the ceiling fan, open the windows and come back -- problem solved!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: 2nothome
Reviews.Content: La Pensione has a great location in the middle of Little Italy, and with easy access to transportation. Rooms are small but nice, and the staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok place”
Reviews.Author: qxl
Reviews.Content: Location-wise to travel around is easy, downtown by trolley, old town too, and short taxi ride to the airport. It's in the middle of Little Italy, easy access to the Farmer's market on Saturday, and lots of restaurants nearby. But because of this (noise especially in the weekend up to 2 am) and lack of airco, I moved between rooms 3 times, at the end I got a room in the corner with two windows, and then the heat and the noise is significantly reduced. Room is very small though, and no breakfast. They have a laundry facilities with small fee, free wireless internet

Reviews.Title: “Freaking awesome”
Reviews.Author: secretrosegarden
Reviews.Content: Small room no way! I have a 6ft 2 boyfriend who accompanied me on my latest business trip. I was very worried after reading the reviews here and was pleasantly surprised. A bit on the small size but far from horrible. Yes sleeping with the windows open at 10pm and you are going to get street noise. However if you are downtown till say midnight , come back and crash and it's totally quiet. Great service and great area. Fell in love with the burger joint and the local restaurants. I would totally stay here again and the quick ride to the Convention Center was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: pnwbeers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here in July and we had a great experience. At $90 per night the price is unbeatable given the great downtown location. The rooms are small but certainly large enough for two, and while there's no A/C, we stayed during a heat wave and really had no issues with it being too hot. I guess a person who's really sensitive to heat might be advised to avoid this hotel from June through August, but 90% of people should be just fine. Aside from the A/C, the recurring complaints I hear about this hotel are related to ease of parking and noise. Well folks, this hotel is located downtown - where there's going to be some extra noise and parking is going to be a little challenging. That's just part of the deal.

Reviews.Title: “I Hesitate to Review This Place.....”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy_S_1973
Reviews.Content: Because it is the best kept secret in San Diego. The location is absolutely amazing. You are in the heart of Little Italy and have a ton of restaurants to choose from, not all Italian. It is alsoa short walk to the trolley that can take you to Petco (as we did), the Gas Lamp, Old Town or shopping malls. It is nice to go out drinking and not have to worry about driving (or parking for that matter). The staff is so helpful and friendly especially Javier and Penny (the hotel dog) adds a warm, homey touch. There is nothing fancy here, no frills, but it is clean and comfortable and did I mention the location? I think this will be my new place to stay for business and quick getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was like torture, we ended up checking out early when I woke up to a huge bug on my pillow.”
Reviews.Author: Museecho
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are traveling during the Summer, there is no air conditioning here! It gets unbelievably hot in the rooms. Opening the windows at night does some good except for the unbelievable noise from the street below (you are in the middle of Little Italy). So you can pretty much forget about sleeping. The hotel is poorly maintained and the housekeepers and borderline just rude. On our 3rd day we were trying to sleep for awhile early in the afternoon when one of their handymen came to our door and said he needed to do work in our room. We reluctantly (and awkwardly) let him and and he proceeded to drill a hole in the back of the unit that held the fridge so the cord didn't have to come around the front. First of all, was that REALLY necessary? Absolutely not. Secondly, it took 25 minutes which just felt overwhelmingly inconsiderate. Two days later a strange buzzing noise in my ear woke me up. I turned my head to the side and there was a huge bug (about 3 inches in length) right where my head had been. It don't know what it was, a cockroach I suppose, I'm from Washington and had never seen one before. Anyway I put it an a cup, walked straight down stairs and told the man at the counter that this (holding up the cup) just woke me up and I would like to check out immediately. His response? "How did that get in there? Someone must have put in there." Wow. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms,great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: JohnofTaipei
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel from 23 January 2009-27 January 2009. The hotel is situated in a very nice area called Little Italy.It's very close to everything.If you want to make use of public transport:the San Diego trolley is a few minutes away! There are plenty of shops,restaurants and coffee shops in the area.We had the opportunity to eat at most of the restaurants in the area.Try the Italian coffee shop next to the hotel.The coffee is very nice,so are their muffins and Sunday morning waffles!! The only problem we had was the room .It's really very small!! Believe me,it's really small! The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.What I like most about the hotel was the atmosphere.The dog at the lobby(her name is Penny btw) always let me feel like home.They had a fire going in the fireplace.It was a nice touch! It really made me feel at home! Great little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dormaggy
Reviews.Content: After months of research for the best hotel, based on location, price and atmosphere this hotel had it all. While the rooms were smaller similar to what I experienced in Europe it was large enough for the two of us. We arrived early after our cruise and we were able to check in. There is a great coffee shop next door where we found ourselves relaxed and just people watched. our room was on the 4th floor room 418........we had great views. There is no air conditioning, but we did not need it.........and I will warn you that while you are in there with the windows open you will begin to get hungry. The smell of fresh bread and cooking fills the air on this street.......absolutly yummy. We walked around looking for the best restaurant and while many looked great, I couldnt help going back twice to Filippis Pizza Grotto the prices and portions are great. While I am more of NY style pizza (thin crust) this pizza was thick crust and I guess I am just spoiled, but the pasta was great and meatballs. The people at the hotel were helpful and yes there is Penny the cutest dog you have ever met. I would suggest this hotel to everyone. When I return to San Diego, I do plan on staying here again. The two nights we stayed went by quickly and they are very helpful with any of your questions and suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Way too noisy”
Reviews.Author: x94cherry
Reviews.Content: I've never checked out of a hotel early in my life, but we left this one after one night of a 4-night stay. The room was OK, management was nice, but it was way too noisy for us. The hotel does not have air conditioning, so you have to sleep with the windows open if it's warm out. This would be fine, except for the fact that big jets fly right overhead every 20 minutes or so, and big trucks and tour buses go by constantly. Oh, and it's a block from the train station, so a train goes by about every half hour, blowing its whistle the whole time. The buses and planes stop around midnight and start back up around 7 AM, the trains go by all night. This makes it impossible to sleep. Also, the parking they provide is in the tiniest, most cramped parking structure I've ever seen. My rented Ford Focus would barely fit in a spot, and I was concerned that it would be damaged after 4 days of parking there. The room was very, very small, but clean and fairly nice and the hotel is in a good location. Had it not been for all the noise, it would have been a good value at $70 a night. We moved to Hotel Occidental, which offers a similar European-type setup for about the same price, but without the noise and with much nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Want to rent a tenament, then go here!”
Reviews.Author: ruby1027
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in the room for 2 minutes. It was horrifying and extremely misleading compared to the website. It was sweltering hot with no air conditioning. The bathroom was dark and dingy. The room was the size of a nice walk in closet. The parking is free according to the management. If you consuder that to be "find your own in the city" and park free between 6pm and 8am and you only have to run to the meter and feed it every hour. Considering there was stickball being played in the street , and most of the streets were closed down for the games. We would have had to park five blocks away, which is really inconvenient to run to feed the meter. They didn't even have an area to pull up and unload your luggage and check in. The underground onsite parking was a basement with a dozen spots you could pay $10 a day for, and was the tightest parking spots I have ever seen in my life. The hotel desk help was the rudest, care about nothing man I have ever experienced at a hotel, and should look for a different line of work. Maybe it is the only type of person they could hire for the spot, since I am positive they person has to put up with hysterical crying women and angry men on a daily basis. Not the vacation get away we planned. After five hours of our weekend wasted, we finally obtained a new hotel room elsewhere on a very busy Labor day weekend. Thank you Marriot!!

Reviews.Title: “A good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: elemeche
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past, so I knew what to expect. The room is small, but clean. Housekeeping did a very good job over my five day stay. I didn't have a car, so the parking situation didn't effect me, and the trolley stop was very near the hotel, so I just used that during my stay. The staff was friendly, one of them remembered me from a previous stay. The cafe next to the lobby was convenient for sandwiches and coffee. Now on Saturday mornings, Little Italy has an outdoor market. Some of the food was for cooks (sauces, pastas, etc.) but there was also fresh fruit and pastries. Parker's pastries had the best stuff at affordable prices. I don't know how this would effect the parking garage, as the market starts right in front of the hotel, but it was a great way to get food for guests. The weather was very cool during my stay, so lack of ac didn't bother me, and I was in San Diego for a convention, so I didn't need to stay in my room alot. I should also say that the neighborhood seemed very safe. When walking back to the hotel on Saturday night, the restaraunts had people sitting outside and people were out walking their dogs, so I never had to worry. I plan to stay here again, and already have a room held for next year's convention.

Reviews.Title: “Nice play to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Thekramer
Reviews.Content: We stayed there four nights. The hotel is well located, near the trolley line, Italian restaurants, the harbor, etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had a place to park our car in their underground parking lot. Yes the parking is small, but if you have a regular compact car it is ok. The rooms are small but they are clean. The bathroom is really small, the sink is not in the bathroom, it is located in your room. It was kind of noisy, with the airport being so close. Our room was in the back of the hotel so we heard the planes and street noises but it was fine. We knew what to expect. This is what you get when you pay around 100$ per night in San Diego. But for the price I would recommend it. It is clean, well-located, and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Stan- Very Rude- poor customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LovingSanDiegoCA
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to come to this quaint hotel, only to leave early because of such a poor and RUDE welcome from Stan- the customer service representative, and after complaining to the Manager, he did discover he violated 4 of his company policies, but NEVER offered an appology to us. The underground parking is horribly tight and our bathroom smelled of old urine. Will not recommend and in fact will tell my friends to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value -- and they have parking!”
Reviews.Author: sfmwh
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else here says, what you see is what you get at La Pensione. For a low price, you get a decent hotel with clean rooms and friendly service in a fun neighborhood. Amenities include coin washers/dryers (very handy) and underground parking for only $10/day. It's not the Four Seasons, but it's a great option for budget-conscious travelers coming to San Diego. And another plus side -- this hotel is just expensive enough that it doesn't attract the transients and low-lives who typically lurk around the truly "deep and cheap" places.

Reviews.Title: “Averagely Average”
Reviews.Author: ScenicSoul
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 2 nights. The rooms were on the small side but for the most part in good shape (our bathroom could have used a bit of work). The rooms facing the back of the property have a pretty nice view but also lots of noise from the trains. "Little Italy" is a 2 block strech that happens to have a few Italian restaurants, it was nothing to write home about. The hotel has a cute dog that hangs out on the sofa in the lobby. The staff wasn't was warm and friendly as I would have liked. Overall it wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Pass Mark”
Reviews.Author: gastro_tripper
Reviews.Content: This was the first accommodation I have booked using Trip Advisor. I was apprehensive after reading all the comments but my experience was a positive one. The hotel is well placed next to Little Italy. I had a 20 min walk to the Conference Centre as expected which was no problem. The staff were very helpful and there were no problems. Penny is a lovely soft coated wheaton terrier (which we also have). The room (10) was tiny, up a small slow lift, and very basic but clean and satisfactory but no airconditioning and with the windows open, the trains do disturb your sleep at night. For the price, if you want budget accommodation and your expectations are modest then this hotel is a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tippiv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The rooms were a bit small but they were clean. The hotel itself was situated in the Italian quarter, so there were a few nice restauants close by. There was also a nice courtyard which led through to a busy italian for breakfast. Some of the staff in there were very nice and some not (mainly the men). Trattoria fantastica over the road was much better, although not quite as busy. The resident dog was very cute at La Pensione. The staff were reasonably friendly, some more than others. I would stay again, for a couple of nghts, as a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel, If You Like This Kind of Thing”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: For me, La Pensione was a great hotel. It's cheap ($90) and well located in San Diego's lively Little Italy district, 2 blocks from a trolley stop (and about 6 blocks from the downtown core). There are lots of restaurants and grocery stores within a few blocks. But La Pensione is very basic. It's clean and comfortable enough. There's not much space left in the room after they fit in a queen bid, an armoire for a (small, multi-channel) TV, a desk, and a sink, which is outside the bathroom. You won't find fancy soaps or a bathrobe or even a radio, which was the one item I really missed. Many people have made a big deal of the lack of air conditioning. At least on this trip opening the window and turning on the electric fan did just fine. There's also a ceiling fan and a (rather noisy) fan setting in the radiator. I did hear some loud trains, which I found startling but not really upsetting. It's a plus to be so close to the train station. There's a lovely cafe for cappucino and the like downstairs, and a restaurant, which I didn't try. So, if you want pretty furnishings and upscale trappings go elsewhere, you'll get more than a glimpse of bare walls here. But to me this is a great urban neighborhood hotel, and I wish there were more of them. It reminded me a bit of a newer version of the French Hotel in Berkeley--which some of our visitors loved and some hated. I also didn't have a car, so I didn't have to hassle with that--walking and transit (the trolley and buses) did just fine. La Pensione delivered what I wanted and expected.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but good”
Reviews.Author: Brocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Pensione for 1 night post-cruise. We like quirky hotels and La Pensione is very interesting from the outside. The staff were friendly as was Penny the canine greeter! The corridors are very institutional/hostel like. Our room was a good size but with cheap furniture. The bathroom was big. If it has been "re-decorated" as we were advised, it hasn't been done well! The important thing was the bed was comfortable and everything was clean. It is in the middle of Little Italy and the restaurants all around are great. We went across the road for a really good breakfast. San Diego is wonderful and very easy to get around from here. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small”
Reviews.Author: marcusfocus
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but no good if you have a car. The rooms were the smallest I've ever seen. They were clean though and adequately equipped. The location was great, especially for the price and I had a good nights sleep there. However, as with anywhere in that part of San Diego I was woken up by the train in the morning. The underground parking was bad news. It was far too small, we had a Mustang which was easy enough to park and we got a space late enough. However, despite our efforts to park in a way we would least likely attract damage, our car still got hit. Fortunately it was a rental and we had Loss Damage Waiver but it's still a hassle. The hotel staff weren't really bothered when I mentioned it to them. Not really good enough for $10. The hotel room itself was cheap enough though. The entrance to the garage isn't exhaust friendly either for a low car.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: TT410
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a bit nervous booking this hotel after reading some of the negative reviews. Although most of the people seemed to be angry about the parking situation and I knew I wouldn't have a car so I decided to check it out. I was in for a convention and this was a perfect spot. It was a couple of very short blocks to the trolly stop. A great way to get around, if you don't mind waiting a while. Clean, and safe too! The hotel was clean and in a great location. You walk into a purple lobby with comfy chairs and a wood burning fireplace. Very cozy. The rooms are quite comfortable. There is a small fridge in each room which is great for those little extras. The bathroom was very cute with checkered tile flooring and 8 foot ceilings. Very Italian. You are surrounded by wonderful resturants to get the perfect Italian meal. I also want to say that I read some reviews complaining about the owner being mean and nasty. I have to say that he was nothing like that. He was kind, and helpful. The other desk personnel was just fine as well. The only negative I would give to this hotel is that it is a bit noisy. It was either the trolly or the train but one of them had a really loud honk at most hours of the night. If you are a light sleeper, this could be a big probelm. But I would save the extra $150 you would have to spend on a "quieter" hotel, and buy yourself a good set of earplugs. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a cheap weekend!”
Reviews.Author: kathleenborges
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed here for two nights in March and it was the perfect location and close to the trolley system which can take you anywhere you want to go! It is also 2 blocks from the waterfront and close to the airport and right in the heart of Little Italy, which on a weekend was buzzing with activity and we found it hard to find a place to eat dinner, there were so many restaurants to choose from. we found it above average for the cost, which was $79 if you call to make a reservation. it's a small simple room, but if you like to spend more time in your room, then you may as well stay home... you're in San Diego! I would stay here again for the value, if i was coming for a special romantic weekend or with small children, then i would go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, but not great...”
Reviews.Author: TinPeacock
Reviews.Content: First off, the location in Little Italy is great. It's right in the heart of the disctrict with lots of dining options all around (although none of them blew us away, but we only tried a few). But the first thing to know is that because it's right in the midst of the action, YOU HEAR IT ALL: midnight partiers, dogs in the hotel's central courtyard, orbiting police helicopters, crying babies, trains, and the local clock's carillon...Tough if you really want to get a good night's sleep! Other tips--the rooms are very small European style rooms with only a separate "wc" with the toilet and tub/shower inside, the vanity and sink are in the entry area next to the tiny clothes rack, and the only appliance included is a hairdryer--no iron in the room (although they have them at the desk--just test it before you take it back to your room, our first one didn't work) and no alarm clock or radio. Also, if you have a car, we'd definitely recommend reserving a parking space for $10. It's worth it since the local metered spaces may be hard to come by, and your coins buy a lot of time (though they do take all coins, not just quarters). Don't try to enter with a huge car, though, it's tight! Too, anyone with babies--DON'T open the "balcony" door! There was no actual balcony out this door, and a sizeable gap between the threshhold of the door and the bars in front meant that any small child would be in danger of falling through! Crazy! Other notes: basic toiletries, loud-flushing toilets, basic (flat) pillows (though they do give you 4), and not much storage space. On the plus side, the locals were super nice--we were impressed by how friendly everyone in the area was. Have a fun trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryB4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Pensione one night pre-cruise and 2 nights post cruise. The best thing about his hotel is the location. It is right in Little Italy with many restaurants just outside your door. It is also close to the waterfront and the cruise docks. The rooms are small, but adequate with a mini fridge. The staff was very friendly and helpful and even printed our boarding passes for our flight home for us. My only complaint was the noise from the trains that pass over the street about 2 blocks away. Without A/C, we did leave the windows open and the noise was a problem for us. We heard the trains all night long. It would be nice to have a coffee maker in room however, there was an early opening coffee shop only a block away. For the budget minded traveler, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: fromdenile
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great part of town, but for the cost, I would have stayed in another place. Twice, I heard the desk personnel quote a price $20 per night less than what I paid online. When I questioned the desk clerk, I was simply told that when the "regular" room rate went up in price, the online one wouldn't. The rooms are spartan and the windows were so dirty you could hardly see out.. Also, there is no street parking near by and it costs an additional $10 per night to park in the underground garage. The spaces were so tight there that it took alot of time trying to squeeze into a space. There is no restaurant in the hotel and no coffee provided in room. There are restaurants nearby for breakfast, but it would have been really nice to have coffe available before having to leave to find food. Overall, I was very disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, loved the balcony!”
Reviews.Author: VTglobetraveler
Reviews.Content: After looking online and feeling quite discouraged with the exorbitant fees charged by other hotels in San Diego and the surrounding area, I found out about La Pensione from the Frommer's guidebook. (The guidebook's tips on how to visit the zoo are priceless too!) It is a very short cab ride from the airport. The street has many outdoor seating areas for people watching or eating a delicious Italian meal. I enjoyed having a drink on my balcony each evening and breakfast out there each morning. The high wall provided privacy, and I could see the ocean! The British Pub diagonally across the street was a bit rowdie, but I was able to close the windows and turn on the fans and sleep comfortably. There was a $10 fee per day for parking. The garage's spaces are extremely small, but with a compact car, it's doable. The room was small, but clean. The bathroom was actually a good size. I loved having a sink and refrigerator in the room! I would highly recommend this hotel to others and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “No better deal in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: hsblendo
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at La Pensione for the second time because the rate is unbelievable. It's in the fabulous Little Italy neighborhood and less than the budget chains. The rooms are small and Spartan, but clean. It's a long walk or a $5 cab to the gaslamp, Petco park, 4th and B, etc. If you don't come with high expectations, you should be satisfied. Also, as a few reviewers mention, it can get a bit noisy in the corner rooms - our first stay was in the back of the first floor and it was quiet there. For budget travelers or simply those who don't want to spend their time in a hotel room, this is a good option. As the name suggests, it's comparable to "bare basics" Europe rooms -- in both price and quality. If you're ok with no amenities, I recommend this for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: Can't really understand other reviews complaining about the staff, we found them to be helpful and friendly. For the price paid it was good, the area was great. Had no problems with the room or noise. You can walk to the gaslamp quarter and all of the resturants. Although, if you are staying in Little Itay you have to eat at Frippie's just up from the hotel, it is the best Italian food. I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great little non-luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: margie3k
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is $80/night. It's not the Hyatt or the Hilton. If you're expecting luxury, you'll be disappointed. That said, it's a great little hotel in a cute area of town. The rooms are small but clean. There aren't alot of amenities, no coffee machine, no iron in the room, etc, but there's a cafe attached to the hotel, and there's probably an iron around somewhere if you ask. The service is fine but not exceptional. I found the front desk to be friendly and helpful when I asked for directions and a map. They might move at a little slower pace than the chain hotels, but I wasn't in any big hurry, so it was no problem for me. The room was cute. It had a patio overlooking India Street, where there are several Italian restaurants/bars. There's no A/C, and the ceiling fan wasn't working, but the staff had put table fan in the room, and between that and the breeze from the patio, the room was very comfortable. The courtyard in the hotel is a nice place for coffee and reading the paper. The cafe also has outside seating on the sidewalk. I was able to walk everywhere from the hotel (granted, I don't mind LONG walks). It really isn't that far to the downtown Gaslamp district, and it's even closer to the Embarcadero where you can catch the harbor tours, cruise ships, etc. I highly recommend this hotel for an inexpensive, pleasant stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes, the front desk!”
Reviews.Author: sfgroover
Reviews.Content: Wow, the front desk! I have never stayed in a hotel with a more checked out, rude and totally unavailable staff. It blew me away. I had some friends, who live in San Diego, meet me at the hotel for dinner and they could'nt believe how they were treated even as visitors. It was so bizarre that we could'nt stop talking about it at dinner. The room, while very small, was clean, (could use some better amenities, it had a mini fridge but no coffee maker) but I could'nt lock the door! It took us 5 minutes to lock the door from the outside. I never said anything to the front desk because...why bother, just checking in was abuse enough! We ate at an awful (and overpriced) restaurant called " Zagarella", down the street. Thank God for wine and a good sense of humor because thats what saved the evening from disaster. I am in the hospitality business, as are my friends and because of the front desk I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It really was that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Big trouble in Little Italy?”
Reviews.Author: mstlani
Reviews.Content: The hotel IS an attractive venue for a nice, even romantic getaway -- and for a bargain! We live within 60 miles of the locale, so that's what I had in mind. There seems to be a recurring complaint about a certain manager, however; and sadly, I'm going to have to add to that list. Printed brochures available in the lobby, as well as the website information listed the room price at $79.00 per night. I booked online, and every webpage reflected this price right up until I submitted the charge authorization. The price suddenly jumped up to $90.00 with no explanation. Upon checking in, I asked why the discrepancy in pricing. BE ADVISED THAT BY BOOKING ONLINE, YOU WILL PAY A SURCHARGE TO THE AGENCY THAT HANDLES THEIR BOOKING (thus, you'll pay $90.00). IF YOU PHONE THE HOTEL DIRECTLY TO BOOK, THE PRICE IS AS LISTED ($79.00). THIS IS NOT STATED ANYWHERE ON THE WEBSITE OR ON THEIR BROCHURES. This revelation at the desk was a bit surprising, but the unpleasant part was when the manager essentially called me a liar for telling him that the website quotes the $79.00 price throughout the booking process. He became somewhat belligerent in his denial, and wouldn't acquiese to checking the website while we were standing there, even though I told him we were staying anyway (after all, it's only $11.00). Funny thing, at check-out, he was all smiles, and when we reviewed the bill in the car, he had knocked off $10.00. Oh,and the website now quotes the $90.00/night price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, AWFUL manager!!!”
Reviews.Author: DanTourist
Reviews.Content: This WOULD have been be a four star review. The rooms were small, the shower not great, the parking a little tight - but everything else (until our last night) was fantastic, especially considering the low price - the location, the desk staff, cleanliness, atmostphere, even the resident dog Penny was always happy to see us.. The problem was when we had to deal with the manager. I was downtown while my girlfriend waited in the lobby. I was taking longer than she expected so she curled up on the couch. The manager came and saw her, and accused her of being HOMELESS. She told him she was a guest, and had been for seven nights, and he flew off the handle and called her a LIAR, reducing her to tears. The girl at the desk, obviously mortified, tried to make out that this was his sense of humour. When I returned and asked to speak to him I realised this was no joke. Simply for asking what he had said to my girlfriend he told me I was "messing with the wrong guy". I asked why he had approached her in this manner and he made out that, yes, she is a liar and also crazy and he wanted her removed. If I wanted to "make something of it" he would gladly kick us out there and then. He refused to apologise to either of us saying that this would be false and he would be a hypocrite. The very least I wanted at this stage was some customer service, but I don't think this man has any concept of this. He single handedly ruined our last night of an otherwise happy time in San Diego. I would normally recommend this hotel. I just want to warn you however that if you have any issues during your stay, this is the guy you have to deal with. He would rather check you out than help you. In our case he caused the problem in the first place with his unprovoked verbal abuse. He absolutely does not deserve your custom. A real shame because this hotel was otherwise fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “great location and price, if a little noisy with no AC!”
Reviews.Author: europeangirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 5 nights in la pensione hotel in little Italy. Got a good deal online. Very happy with the location, in little italy near great restaurants and a nice english pub across the road with hearty meals and inexpensive drinks! hotel is one block from the trolley which takes you to mexico (Tijana) or the beach (Pacific,Ocean etc). 15 min walk from shopping area and the gaslamp quarter and a cheap taxi cab from the airport. Excellent location. Room - good size, we had a junior suite with a queen bed and private bath and shower with excellent pressure, TV, fridge, table and chair and sink in the room but much storage for luggage and NO AIR CON. The room does have a ceiling fan and another small fan but these do not do enough to quell the heat. The only other fault I had with this place is the noise. Let me point out that I never complain about noise normally, but these trains (which run ALL through the night only a block away) have REALLY loud beeps!! A heavy sleeper, I was very surprised to be woken by them every single night, but as we had to have the window open to leave in some air into the stuffy room.....catch 22..either be really hot or have a loud noise every hour through the night....!!! That said, I would probably go back to this hotel based on their location and proximity to everything we needed to see, but the noise and heat was a bit annoying by the 3rd restless night! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “La Pensione a great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macaranga
Reviews.Content: Ok the rooms may be a tad small but were very clean and adequate for our weeks stay. The hotel is very well positioned and was a breeze on getting to the main sites of interest. Being from Australia and our first visit to San Diego we found the staff very helpfuland a delight to deal with. Yes we will be returning and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value! A great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HDMay21
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best values I have found in hotels! My husband and I stayed here for our 2nd anniversary, and found it a great romantic destination. The location was perfect - in the middle of Little Italy, downtown San Diego, just minutes from the zoo and seaworld and a trolley ride away from Petco Park and the Gaslight district. The rooms were ultra clean, which is always my number one priority. I read reviews on this site before our stay and was warned about the size being small, but we stayed on the southwest corner and our room was very well-sized and nicely arranged. The lack of air conditioning was no issue even in May; we enjoyed opening the windows to let in the ocean breeze. I will make a small comment about the train noise and the church bells that start about 7 am and go on about every half hour, but not a problem at all. The staff was very friendly, the lobby was like a living room, and the cute Italian coffee shop downstairs was our little kitchen. The garage was a little small, but it appears they are careful not to oversell it which makes it easier to get in and out. If you aren't into the big resorts and the costs/crowds that come with them, I HIGHLY recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diego_P
Reviews.Content: I make an annual trip to San Diego and have stayed at La Pensione for the past few years. Even if I had a much higher budget, I would still stay at this charming little hotel in Little Italy. It is exactly what the cloned hotel chains are not: intimate, charming, personable, with lots of character. It's true that the rooms are small and there is no a/c (I've been comfortable there in mid-August) , so it's not for those who want a run-of-the-mill chain hotel experience. However, there is a very good authentic Italian restaurant attached, as well as an espresso bar adjacent to the picturesque hotel courtyard. The staff are friendly and considerate, including "Penny" the giant schnauzer. If you're looking for a fun experience and a flavor of Italy, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: oceaneyez
Reviews.Content: Parking and Staff at this hotel are a nightmare! Prior to check-in we were promised additional overnight parking options if their lots were full, none were provided. The front desk refused to help us find any reasonable parking near the area and was unbelievably rude. When we requested a manager, he initially refused to speak to us. Upon requesting his presence, for the second time, he stormed out of his office and told us that he was "pissed off " that we were interrupting his dinner. He informed us that he would rather check us out than offer any parking suggestions. When we inquired about someone else being willing to help us he stated, "I'm it. I'm god." We gladly checked out and found another hotel just down the street even on a busy holiday weekend with no problems. Save yourself the headache and trouble - yes, the area is great but there are other better options in the area with excellent customer service, good prices, and parking - plus the rooms are small and smell of mildew here anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, tiny room, lacking amenities”
Reviews.Author: MrPizz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good deal for the price, but it not perfect by any means. The location could not be better, its right in the middle of Little Italy, with tons of good restaurants within a few blocks, and a nice coffee shop in the building. It also within easy walking distance of all of downtown including the gaslamp district. The building itself is attractive, and the inner courtyard and lobby give it the look of a high-end boutique hotel, not the budget hotel it is. There were, unfortunately, a number of downsides. First, the rooms were very small. We were coming from New York and are used to small rooms, but our room was claustrophobic even for us. In addition, we were on the second floor with a window facing India Street, so there was significant street noise, although it was not unbearable (then again, we have a high tolerance for that sort of thing). More annoyingly, sound-wise, was the old plumbing. Every time the room above us flushed their toilet, it was extremely loud in our room, to the point that it woke me up several times. Finally, the shower was pretty pathetic, a tepid stream with almost no pressure, along with cheap soap and shampoo and old thin towels. In summary, this hotel presents an attractive face, but it doesn’t follow through on the rooms. That having been said, for $90 a night, I still think it is a good bargain based on its great location, especially if you don’t plan on spending much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Major Issues”
Reviews.Author: TravelproCA
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel because of its convenience. The rooms are so pokey, and so many things need fixing. Light bulbs and TV remote were out. The shower has almost no water pressure - even a balding man couldn't rinse his shampoo. Towels are old and give you a dermabrasion because they are so "sandpaperish". Bedding and sheets leave a lot to be desired. The noise level from the street and surrounding areas is not helped by the flimsy single-paned windows and because of the lack of airconditioning, windows need to be open in order to breathe. Parking is totally inadequate, spaces allowing only for cars the size of a Mini Cooper. The manager and his assistant were rude and had a definite no-care attitude. The best part of the hotel is the resident dog in the foyer and the aroma of the soap in the bathrooms. Would not recommend this unless you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever, stay away at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: azguy5
Reviews.Content: I drove over 6 hours to stay at this hotel and what a waste of time that was. The staff here was unbelievably rude and not at all helpful from the onset. They lied about parking availability and would not offer any alternatives when hotel parking was "unavailable." Both the front desk person and hotel manager were irate and uncooperative in every respect. The manager basically said to get out and get your refund because he did not want to deal with us. We gladly did so as we would never want to stay at a horrible place like this that treats their guests like crap. What a suprise and what a dissapointment this was. We could not believe there were people in the industry who acted so unprofessionally. Save yourself the time and trouble and find a respectable hotel with staff who actually care about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with La Pensione.”
Reviews.Author: AmyPC
Reviews.Content: My partner and I liked this hotel a lot, it had a good feel about it. The guys on reception were really friendly and helpful and gave us good suggestions and information on good restaurants, places to go etc. Yes, the room was tiny, but that didn't bother us. It had a comfortable bed, a window overlooking the street and room for our suitcases and that was all we needed. Loved Penny, the dog at reception, lying around in hysterically funny poses - so cute. Little Italy was a great place to stay, we walked all over the place - the Gaslamp area, the Harbour, the trolley to Tijuana - it was really convenient. The only downside was the noise from the trains - they were pretty loud! Otherwise, all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It !”
Reviews.Author: TLS72
Reviews.Content: La Pensione is a lovely small hotel in the heart of Little Italy, San Diego. The rooms are small and only have queen beds so only really suitable for a single person or couple. I had a room on the third floor which was very quiet and very clean. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful as I had never been to San Diego before I had many questions regarding directions etc. The area of Little Italy is a fantastic location, lots of lovely restuarants, cafes etc and a great coffee shop is attached to the La Pensione Hotel. It was about a 10 minute walk to the downtown area/ Gaslamp district and a 5 minute walk to the closest trolley station. It is also about a 5 minute walk to the harbour area. The hotel also has underground parking for $10 per day which was very handy as the surrounding areas are all metered parking. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at La Pensione and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: lsparcl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in June 2006 and had a wonderful experience. I agree with the other reviewers: the neighborhood is fun and safe, near to the trolley and freeway access. The rooms are small but clean and well kempt. I thought the in-room refrigerator was a bonus. Even though the garage is small, we didn't have too much difficulty parking our 4-door rental car. On the other hand, I wouldn't have wanted to try and park a truck or SUV. During my visit, the weather was unusually hot for June.
