Luckily, I had a room on the harbor side (fourth floor, room 12) and was able to catch the cool night breezes (and even had a glimpse of the water). My sister stayed in a room around the corner of the building and her room was at least 10 degrees warmer than mine. So if you are concerned about the heat, try and get a room with some breezes. One other thing to note about the location: the hotel is a couple of blocks from the train station and the night trains are very noisy. Apparently the engineers blow their horns to clear the tracks of sleeping people. While it is a beautiful and haunting sound, if you are a light sleeper, consider another part of town. That said, the noise bothered me on the first night, but not the second. I will gladly stay there again -- and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: emilee_leblanc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Pensione for several nights. The rooms are small but well equipped with two sinks, a small refrigerator, a TV, and phone. They vary a great deal in size and configuration, so ask to look if you don't like what you first see or hear. The location is wonderfully convenient--you can walk to most places, the trolley is close, and underground parking is free. There are several good restaurants very close by, but the breakfast thing is less appealing and cruising for caffeine was a pain. (A quick trip to Old Town yields a great breakfast.) One evening we used their courtyard for take out and some beers. There is a fireplace and a dog in the lobby--nice touch. This property is unique and the prices are terrific. Call, instead of using the website, and you will save about 10%.

Reviews.Title: “A value for the budget minded in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Who knew San Diego had an Italian neighborhood. The LIttle Italy neighborhood--home of La Pensione Hotel--is great and also close to the harbor and downtown.. The hotel is actually more of an Inn--and for the budget minded. My room was small, needed vacuming, dusting, and a few other minor items. Also, the nearby Lindbergh Field and MTA transit station made it a tad noisy -- which is true of many hotels downtown. That being said, if you are a budget minded single or couple traveller, you might La Pensionne. It's no chain cookie cutter and with all the great nearby Italian restaurants and coffee bars, you have saved enough to slurge on them.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: bodyfit
Reviews.Content: Great location, you can walk to the trolley to go anywhere in San Diego, or eat at excellent reastaurants that are very close to walk to. The hotel is a great bargain for the price. Use the $10 per day parking for your car. You cant park on the street for any period of time without a ticket. You dont need a car to enjoy this city. The rooms are small and adequate, nothing special, but fine. The staff is cordial and helpful. The lobby dog, Penny, is the best. Call for the best price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Roundwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights. Location was great. Very close to downtown San Diego and all the tourist attractions i.e. "Old Town", San Diego Zoo, Bilboa Park and Fashion Centre. Hotel was basic but clean and we were glad that we had a room overlooking the courtyard as other members of our party found it difficult to sleep due to the noise level of the trains. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about La Pensione”
Reviews.Author: pescegirls
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty little boutique hotel in Little Italy, very affordable and convenient to the trolley and San Diego's neighborhoods. We were there in October during a cool and rainy spell, so AC wasn't an issue for us. With the windows open, the street sounds were invigorating... for the first hour or so. After that, it became just plain noisy until midnight. Our room overlooked several restaurants with sidewalk seating, so there was a buzz of conversation and traffic anytime we were in the room. There was also the roar of jet engines as planes came and went from the airport not far away. It was a little wild to look out the window and see the jets coming in for a landing over the rooftops of Little Italy! With the curtains drawn for privacy from sundown on, our room felt very small and crowded, although it was clean and nicely decorated in a simple European-feeling style. The towels we had one day were surprisingly thin and frayed at the edges, but the replacements the next day seemed a little newer. The mattress seemed extremely hard and the pillows very loosely packed and uncomfortable. There was a night table on one side of the bed but not the other, which was inconvenient. The plumbing was quite noisy. No coffee available in the room, and the nearest java was downstairs in the overpriced cafe that appeared to be popular with neighborhood locals. We did have wireless internet access, which was a bonus. The desk staff appeared to have been schooled in similar urban ennui. Parking under the hotel is limited, with tight spaces. The property itself is stylish in a simple way, and the location and price are bound to keep it booked up. But if you are looking for a quiet, comfy place to rest at the end of the day, this hotel may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Go here for the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kybusguy
Reviews.Content: There's a few things you have to accept before making your reservation and staying at the La Pensione Hotel. First and foremost, this is a cute little boutique hotel nestled amidst a very cool neighborhood of Little Italy. The reason you'll be staying here is for it's attractive price tag and because it's surrounded with the restaurants and activity of Little Italy. The rooms ARE small and NOT air-conditioned. Many hotels in San Diego don't have air conditioning because evenings are generally cool. That being said, if you're going to be staying in your hotel room during the daytime hours in the summer, the rooms may become stuffy and warm. There are fans in the rooms that assists with circulating the cool San Diego air during the evening hours. The rooms are clean and well-appointed. My room DID NOT have a coffee maker. There is a little cafe open in the morning adjacent to the property that serves breakfast (and of course coffee). The front desk staff is more-or-less accommodating, though not particularly friendly. The night audit person that I encountered during my visit was outright rude and disrespectful. But, the lobby dog, Penny, is a very nice touch and adds a "homey" feeling to the place. I will be staying at the La Pensione Hotel again since I found it to be a bigtime value for it's location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat noisy on weekends”
Reviews.Author: Zonaboys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past July. Found the staff very friendly and especially the lobby dog! However, parking was very difficult in the underground parking garage and very difficult to find if parking on street. Rooms were nice. We suggest room on Bayside away from street noise on east side of hotel. And warning.... don't always count on cool summer days and nights in San Diego you will suffer without airconditioning!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but not recommended for hot summer nights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, with prices that beat nearly everything in the area. Unfortunately, staying in San Diego in the summer in a hotel with no air conditioning is not a good idea. We had stayed here once before, in March, and loved the decor, location, and price. But in July the heat in the small rooms proved to be nearly unbearable, even with fans at full blast. I would recommend staying there any other time of the year though - it is within walking distance to the great places to eat in the Gas Lamp, and we even walked all the way to the ball park with no problem. It is also near a trolley station which easily takes you to anywhere you want to go in San Diego.(The Princess Pub across the street from La Pensione has some of the best fish tacos in all of San Diego - and it is a British Pub!) Overall, a great deal, just not in the heat of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome!! My boyfriend and I stayed here for our anniversary trip to SD and we were very pleased with the service and room we got! The DOWNSIDE of the hotel is the PARKING.. when I read the reviews of the hotel and saw parking was an issue, I thought people were overexaggerating..but it's TRUE! It's so tiny my civic could barely fit in one of the stalls. If you're not a good parker and/or if you have a mid-size or larger car don't park in the structure.. instead park in the spaces in front of the hotel. The ROOMS- are quite small, if you are used to sleeping in a big spacious room-don't stay here... but it was perfect for us~ Other than that the place was PERFECT. The location was perfect too! Right near everything.. gaslamp, coronado, downtown, seaworld, etc. The restaurant below was a little pricey but it was sooo delicious! The pub across the street was great, (however they close early-like 12:30-1:00am) met some friendly people there. One good tip is to call before you reserve a room say online. They give you good discounts on the phone, probably better than the rate you were given online.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Phxnative
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for July 4th. I found this hotel based on the reviews of others on tripadvisor. I booked at last minute and was surprised that they had rooms available. The location of this hotel is just perfect! We were a block from the trolleys, a few miles from the zoo and and a short walk from the piers. The neighborhood is great! There is a Engish pub across the street that was a ton of fun, especially during the world cup games. I reserved a corner room based on reviews I had read, and had plenty of room for 2 people. We had a corner room facing the street, and the noise was not to bad, granted we didnt go to sleep till after 2am each night, so the bars and restaurants were closed by then. Having no AC was not to bad, staying there in July it was a little warm, but still very comfortable. The parking was interesting, just like other reviews, unless you have a small car, stay out of the parking garage. I loved the small cafe downstairs, I had breakfest there every morning. It is fair priced and the pastries are tasty. Also, they have a really cute dog named Penny that lives in the lobby. The management was very nice and helpful. I can't wait to come back to San Diego to stay here. This is one of the best boutique hotels I have ever stayed at. Great Job La Pensione!!

Reviews.Title: “La Pensione Hotel - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here only on the recommendation of Trip Advisor reviews. It was well worth the $79.00 per night. The rooms were a little small, but CLEAN and comfortable. Request a corner room away from India street. It is a bit noisey. No air, we closed the windows and turned on both fans and we were fine. I guess in July and August it can get a bit warm in there. The garage is a hoot. If you need to rent a car, make sure it is the smallest that the rental car agent has, better yet would be a motorcycle. This is a very laid back,artsy, friendly atmosphere. Anyone can feel very comfortable here. Located in Little Italy means lots of yummie restaurants, and they sure were. A nice little wine stop with light fare is just down the block too. Easy walk to Gaslamp and Seaport Village. Close enough to drive to Coronado and LaJolla. LaJolla is well worth a day trip if you love the ocean and shopping. Sort of reminded me of Rodeo Drive with the ocean a few feet away. Although not the same stores the atmosphere is surely there. I would stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful llittle place!”
Reviews.Author: kennlise
Reviews.Content: The room was neat and perfectly clean. The bed was very comfortable. We requested & got a corner room which had a balcony facing the main street. There is no A/C but the room stayed nice & cool. We had very little noise from the street, not enough to bother us while we slept. There's a great pub across the street with good food, lots of italian restaurants (though pretty pricey) and a bakery a few doors down from the pub that served a great made to order & inexpensive breakfast. The staff was very nice & helpful. The trolley that can take you anywhere is 2 blocks away and there's a 7/11 half way there, perfect for stocking your mini-fridge. Gaslamp district is an easy trolley ride away & about a $6 taxi ride. Ask at the desk how to get to the Zoo on public transport, it's super easy. Same for Tijuana.

Reviews.Title: “Little Italy's Gem”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoCoach
Reviews.Content: This is a nice plain hotel with double beds and a bath/ shower for only $75 . But you didn't go to San Diego to sit in the hotel. It is nicely located only a couple of blocks from the harbor tours and the trolley. Downtown is 6 blocks away. The dining in the neighborhood is excellent and with the money you are saving you can afford to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed here in September 2005. Great value, great location, great hotel. Room was clean, staff was very nice, truly a great experience. In fact I just booked it again for this Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Located in the Little Italy area, near downtown and the wharf area. Within easy walking distance of trolley (which goes to Old Town, shopping, arena and Tijuana), downtown, Gaslight District and more. Comfortable rooms, good price, but lousy parking. Next time we will skip the rental car, since public transportation is so convenient. We've already booked our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent on La Pensione”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was very cool, with an alternative to the cookie cutter American low end chain hotel/motel seen. In the heart of Little Italy, good restaurants and coffee shops to go to. It was nice to see this uinique area of San Diego. If you plan to stay in the inner city of San DIego and not go to the beaches, this is a good place to stay at and to just catch the trolley a couple blocks away that will take you to the zoo, Gaslamp, etc. No need for a car. The rooms are TINY. There's basically not a place to put you suitcase without it being in the way. But that's what you get when you stay at a place that was built decades ago when people needed less space. If you plan on being out and about in the city, then this place is OK. If you want to chill for long periods of time at the hotel, this is not your place. The desk help was below average, not very friendly. Also, they forgot to leave shampoo/condtioner the first night and my girlfriend was not pleased. For the price I would say it is average. It is very clean, but its staff did not give me the cool experience I thought I would expect at a remodels vintage hotel. Also, I hoped the interior would be a little more cozy. Instead they have these ugly grren metal doors and bland white walls. Very sterile and industrial.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chellys
Reviews.Content: For the cost, the la pensione is quite a bargain. Do ask for a room on the courtyard if noise is a problem with you. The desk clerks are personable and helpful. Very nicely located in little Italy. Tight parking but free.

Reviews.Title: “The Neatest”
Reviews.Author: wkuman82
Reviews.Content: Just got back from San Diego..stay at this motel, very neat motel,very clean, close to all attractions, parking lot small but always found a spot, if you do stay always try to get a room facing the street, views of city are great, you will hear the train horns from time to time but it only bothered us one night. We paid $69.00 booked through Southwest airlines special, this is a steal in San Diego..parking is free also. Little Italy is good area for eating, but could not find that many shops. Be sure and check out all the italian groceries and wine shops.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this place as an alternative to the $130 a night Hampton Inn for a wedding. I could not have made a better decision. I was slightly cautious as there are a few negative reviews for this place. I am sure some of the complaints are founded, as not everything will be perfect for $75/night. For example: 1) Chain lock on our door was busted (We didn't care, still had deadbolt) 2) Elevator made some funny noises (The liscense expired while we were there, again didn't really care) These issues didn't bother me enough to talk to the front desk, so I can't comment on how they deal with this kind of thing if it really bothered somebody. The location in little italy truly is fantastic. If I was staying in San Diego again, I would not hesitate to book here unless the temperature was going to be hot, as there is no AC, and I could see this being a possible issue if the temperatures were in the 80s or above. Overall, great experience and highly recommend to the budget concsious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at La Pensione Hotel we were rudely greeted by the clerk working the front desk. This man was short with his responses and out right snippy when we asked for alternative parking and directions to the train depot. Parking is not adequate at La Pensione, the hotel only has about 25 spots available for 75 rooms. Metered parking or paying up to $15.00 a day to park in a parking garage that is a few blocks away would be your options. The rooms are small but clean. The hot water in the shower will turn cold or extra hot at will. ( I guess it has a mind of its own). The rooms do get stuffy as this hotel does not have A/C for any of its rooms.

Reviews.Title: “a happy accident...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While dining in Vincenzo's on our first afternoon in SanDiego, we noticed people carting their luggage past the restaurant, into an open-air piazza that connects the restaurant & a coffee shop. Our waiter informed us that there was a hotel attached to both buildings...something we'd failed to notice when we'd arrived! Taking a chance, we were given the key to Room #223 - a corner room overlooking India Street. It's one of their larger rooms, but was only $75 a night! Quite a bargain for the location - at night India Street is romantic & beautiful with white lights strung throughout the trees that line it & a large sign in blue neon arches across it. It's within walking distance of Broadway for the Spreckles Theatre & some great dining (when you're NOT feeling like Italian, of course!) The free undergrround parking was nice, but VERY - VERY TIGHT!! Your best bet--rent the smallest car possible & you shouldn't have too much trouble. However, it did lead to some comedic moments, so it was worth it! We were set to leave one day, checked out, got the airport & realized how much we wanted to stay, so we drove back to La Pensione to re-check in! Unfortunately they were doing maintenance on the room already, so we got another one---this time on the 4th floor - #419 I think? Very cool view from the outdoor walkways - you can see right down to the piazza. This room was miniscule, though! Glad we lucked out with #223 the first time, or I might not have such fond memories!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: IrelandVisitor
Reviews.Content: It has been some years since we stayed at the La Pensione. We thought we had found good low price hotel. It had some problems - the pillows were so bad that we bought two cheap pillows and the nearby train was a bit noisy. The incident that made us decide never to return was the night they decided to power wash the sidewalks at midnight! There was going to be a parade in the morning and the owner had told the manager to power wash the sidewalk. This went on for an hour or more and the sound carried throughout the building making sleeping impossible. The lack of concern for the comfort of the guests soured us on this hotel forever.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: matthijst
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel for a great price. Knew up front that the rooms are a bit small. We were in room 313, not too big, but clean. The hotel offers free wireless internet. Location is great: in the heart of Little Italy and a few blocks from the ocean. 7-11 is nearby. Oh, it also features free underground parking, which is great cause you can use the trolley when travelling around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “You won't get any sleep!”
Reviews.Author: miwilyn
Reviews.Content: It's been 2 years since I stayed there, but after reading the reviews I feel obligated to chime in. I still have a horrible feeling from it. The staff were fine, the lobby was fine, and the room was about as I expected. However, we were not given a queen size bed. Apparently at the time there were only a few of those. NO, we had a full size bed to share between the 2 of us. Plus, it was HOT - not when you want to be forced to cuddle in a small bed. Like everyone else who has complained here, we had to have the ceiling fan on and the window open all night. Now unlike air conditioning where the temp is constant, the breeze can give you the chills... so we also fought over the tiny sheet all night. In addition to being kept up by the noise of the trolley/train that is a block away all night long... the little sleep we had was disturbed by the garbage truck at 5:30 in the morning emptying the dumpster under our window on (get this) the Fourth of July! Who knew they worked holidays. Needless to say we checked out the next morning and happily paid 4x the rate for a quite nice hotel elsewhere. I would NEVER go back or recommend it... and I'm someone who has stayed in my share of youth hostels and 1-2 star hotels in many North American and European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Good with a couple of caveats”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at La Pensione during a 6-day stop in San Diego not long ago. Overall, we had a good experience but there are a couple of things that I think are important to share: - Parking was an issue for us. The free garage underneath the building was almost always full (except during the day on weekdays). The parking spots are quite narrow and as a whole the garage is very tight. Our rental car was a fairly big Buick Century and that didn't help much - a compact car would do better here. Street parking so close to Little Italy was tough sometimes - spots are few and far between and are often restricted (limited parking duration during the days, and one day of the week off-limits for street cleaning). We had supper one night at a restaurant and marveled at how it only took 20 seconds to fill an empty spot in front of us. - We are both fairly sound sleepers, so noise wasn't generally an issue for us. We had a north-facing room (417). Noise from planes/trains/trucks was present a lot of the time. The pillows could have been better too. - The shower wasn't comfortable - it varied too much from too hot/too cold. As a whole, the room itself didn't get especially hot. Other than that, what can I say? It is really good value in a relatively expensive tourist destination like San Diego. The room was quite clean and the in-room mini fridge was helpful to us. The dog in the lobby is friendly and the hotel has great access to freeways. La Pensione has a lot going for it, and I would recommend it to people who are looking for a decent budget hotel. ps. You have to check out Extraordinary Desserts on Union St - it's within walking distance and has some fantastic cakes.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Italy in San Diego, Ca”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we travel to San Diego close to great Italian restaraunts as well as free parking and within walking distance of Downtown and the Harbor area. Great ambiance. Just be aware that the early morning airport flights might wake you. We reccomend to all of our friends and with a wedding comming soon we hope to see friends stay here! You can definately use your Italian language skills in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.......”
Reviews.Author: omn_19
Reviews.Content: This was a quick trip so we could party for a couple days. There were six of us ages 17-48. Most of our daylight hours were spent in Tijuana (easy ride on the trolley), but nighttime hours were spent at the hotel or right across the street at the pub. We had 3 rooms. . All of the rooms were very clean, well appointed and had daily maid service. Noise wasn't a problem. I never heard the airplanes and hardly noticed the street noise even with the door and windows open. 418 - Small room, good city views - dark curtains. 321 - Small room, 2 glass doors that open to a balcony - bright, blinds only. 320 - Bigger room, 1 glass door that opens to a balcony - not as bright, dark curtains over the window, blinds over the door. None of the rooms have A/C. That was fine in March, but may be a problem in July & August. All rooms have ceiling fans, which produced a good amount of circulation. Each room had a decent size refrigerator. This hotel is convenient to every thing. 1 mile to downtown, Seaport village and the Harbor. 2 miles to old town. 18 miles to Tijuana. All places are easy to reach by the trolley, which is only 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke and Mirrors”
Reviews.Author: simon111
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, this place looked beautiful...very quaint, fireplace in the lobby, tastefully decorated. The rooms are very, very small...cannot over emphasis this. Two people in the room have to coordinate their every move to have access to other points in the room. The bed takes up the entire space with a small space between the end of the bed and the TV. Parking is tight, and we found two trashy cars parked, both with people sleeping in them. We notified the desk person, who said he would tell them to leave. The next evening, both cars were parked in the cramped parking quarters below the hotel, with people living in them still! We complained again to another desk person, who said, "So you're the ones complaining about them. I'll make them leave if that will make you happy!" He was screaming at us! We asked to see the owner, and he proclaimed, "I am the owner." It became obvious to us that this person was "renting" out very limited parking spaces to people living in their cars! You would be better off at a motel in Motel Circle than staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this little hotel. I had read that the rooms were fairly small and they were but plenty big enough with a good size bath. After all it was a place to sleep not play the piano or run around the room. The staff I found to be very friendly, helpful and professional. I spent a little time talking to some of them and they were great people. The street noise didn't bother me. It just added a sense of life to the fullest. The little English Pub across the street was a fun place to sit out and have a drink and visit. Everyone was very friendly everywhere we went. The food in the hotel as all we tried in Little Italy was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kariluz
Reviews.Content: I think that I could go again. It was relative near from the convention center, Downtown, among others. I think that worth the money that you pay. The fact that is in Little Italy, it was great. Restaurants, cafe just down the stairs or at a very short walking distance. Also, it has a trolley station very near. Yes, you heard the train, but not always is passing. The room is not so big but is cozy and comfortable. You always have clean towels and the staff was friendly and ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “won't be going back...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a wide variety of hostels, hotels and motels in 5 different west and southwest states in July '04 before ending up in La Pensione in San Diego for 4 nights during ComicCon, and I can honestly say that this is the only one we chose that's still annoying me more than 6 months later. The trouble with La Pensione is that it *looks* great, it really does. Decor is great, twinkly fairy lights on the outside at night, really extraordinary mural on the inner courtyard wall... sounds great. Enough to sell it, anyhow. The lack of air conditioning didn't even bother me much, even it was slightly sweltering in July, the ceiling fan noise wasn't so bad. They weren't so efficient, either, though, and the minute you pull back the funky purple curtains to open the window... the noise hits you. Front facing rooms are on a crossroads, across the street is a tacky 'English Pub' with outside tables and lots of noise over weekend nights. There's lots of light right outside the window, its near the rail tracks and airport and there's lots of foot and vehicle traffic that got really bad on the Friday/Saturday nights - not fabulous if you want to crash and get a good nights sleep... What really bugged me was that, booking several months in advance, we didn't realise that each room only has a single queen size bed. (I don't recall seeing it on their website at the time, and it would have been a factor in choosing a hotel - I note that they do make a point of it now on the website.) This wasn't the case at any of the dozens of other places we stayed at, and it really wasn't big enough if you need a twin room. If we had realised, we would have booked 2 rooms and been done with it - of course, that wasn't an option when a convention had just descended on town, so we were stuck for the next 5 days. We weren't the only people caught out by this - there were at least 2 others in the queue ahead of me with the same problem when I went to bug the receptionist about it. What annoyed me more was her attitude - it was quite obvious that she would rather have been getting back to the dinner she was apparently eating behind the desk at the time!! None of the staff were particularly friendly or helpful (except the bellhop who fetched us blankets!) and you generally got the impression they would rather the guests weren't there intruding on their precious hotel. God forbid you should want an apology for anything, cos you're not going to get it! I'm pretty sure it wouldn't have been so bad if we'd had another room, or hadn't been stuck there for quite so long. Little Italy is pretty and quaint, but the Gaslamp Quarter and Convention Centre is a good 15 minute walk away and it's probably worth spending a bit more and getting a bit nearer if you're conventioning... Quite frankly, I like my sleep too much to go back there in high season anytime soon!

HotelInfo.Name: La Pensione
HotelInfo.Address: 606 W. Date St., San Diego, CA 92101
